p: Using in silico drug development approach against the dengue nonstructural protein 4B (NS4B), Qaddir et al. docked 2750 phytochemicals from different medicinal plants to the DENV NS4B protein and identified nine phytochemicals possessing potential inhibitory effects against NS4B, including silibinin and other compounds from the plant S. marianum [ 18]. This result suggests that silibinin could potentially inhibit DENV viral replication. Given that molecular docking analysis is only predictive, further in vitro and in vivo studies would be necessary to confirm the antiviral effect.
